doctrines.name: Supremacy Clause
doctrines.description: Federal Constitution and statutes made in pursuance thereof are the supreme law of the land and override conflicting state laws.
tests: Does a state statute conflict with a valid federal statute, regulation, or constitutional protection?
Does the state attempt to authorize what federal law forbids, or forbid what federal law protects?

doctrines.name: Field Preemption
doctrines.description: When Congress occupies an entire field of regulation, states may not legislate in that field even if there is no direct conflict.
tests: Has Congress created a comprehensive regulatory scheme for this subject area (e.g., interstate motor carrier safety)?
Is the state attempting to regulate private individuals as if they are within that federal field?

doctrines.name: Conflict Preemption
doctrines.description: State law is preempted when compliance with both state and federal law is impossible or when state law stands as an obstacle to federal objectives.
tests: Does enforcing the state law frustrate a federal purpose or condition of funding?
Would following the state rule require violating a federal limit or protected right?

doctrines.name: Ultra Vires State Action
doctrines.description: States may not exercise powers not granted by the Constitution or reserved to them under the Tenth Amendment.
tests: Is the state using police or regulatory power beyond what its own statutes and the federal structure authorize?
Is the state treating a private citizen as a commercial actor without a clear constitutional or statutory basis?

doctrines.name: Freedom of Movement / Travel
doctrines.description: Citizens have a protected liberty interest in movement and travel that cannot be restricted by states without due process and constitutional justification.
tests: Does the state condition basic movement on a commercial-style license?
Is liberty of movement being restricted absent individualized suspicion or due process?

doctrines.name: Substantive Due Process
doctrines.description: Government may not arbitrarily infringe fundamental liberties, even if procedures look proper on paper.
tests: Is a fundamental liberty interest (life, bodily integrity, family, movement) being restricted?
Is the restriction narrowly tailored and justified by a legitimate, lawful interest?

doctrines.name: Civil Rights Remedy
doctrines.description: Provides a cause of action against persons acting under color of state law who violate federal rights.
tests: Is the actor a state or local official or someone acting under state authority?
Has a federal right (constitutional or statutory) been violated?
